availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Elkton, Kentucky attorney. Kentucky native. Son of James N. Kennedy and Nancy Kennedy. Married Nannie Greenfield Kennedy in December 1855. Father of L. N. Kennedy, Nannie L. Kennedy, Bland Kennedy, and Mary G. Kennedy. Lived in Todd County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Elkton in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, District 2, p. 251; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, p. 69; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, Elkton, p. 349; Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records â€“ Microfilm (1852-1910), Microfilm rolls #994027-994058, Todd County, KY, December 1855, Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort, Kentucky; Find A Grave, "Samuel W. Kennedy (1823-1879)," Memorial #48573060, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi/pages.suddenlink.net/%2525253C/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=48573060 (accessed May 30, 2017).
